page.title: 15Fathers' Occupations Tongue
page.content: 'We asked all the children in the class what job their father did and then we made a pie chart. We found that every father had a job, two were teachers, two were crofters but all the rest had different jobs. One or two were self-employed such as the joiner, the postmaster-genersl store the fisherman, the mechanic and the crofters. Two worked for a local estate as gamekeeper and as farm manager'. There is seasonal work available in the hotels, but there are very few opportunities for girls in the village to have regular employment. Those who have college or university education usually have to find a job away from home.
